Connects Nuxt with Drupal via the Lupus Custom Elements Renderer
nuxtjs-drupal-ce - Nuxt.js Drupal Custom Elements Connector
Connects Nuxt v3 with Drupal via the
The 2.x version of the module is compatible with Nuxt 3. For a Nuxt 2 compatible version, please checkout the
yarn add nuxtjs-drupal-ce@beta # or npm install nuxtjs-drupal-ce@beta
The module defaults work well with
Get started quickly by scaffolding initial files:
Fetches pages via the custom elements API provided by the
Provides a Nuxt-wildcard route, so all Drupal pages can be rendered via Nuxt.js and vue-router.
Integrates page metadata and the page title with Nuxt.
Supports authenticated requests. Cookies are passed through to Drupal by default.
Supports display of Drupal messages in the frontend.
Provides unstyled skeleton components for getting started quickly.
Supports fetching and display of Drupal menus via the

is replaced by the menu name being fetched.
: The menu base URL. Defaults to drupalBaseUrl + ceApiEndpoint.

: By default, error pages provided by Drupal (e.g. 403, 404 page) are shown,
while keeping the right status code. By enabling customErrorPages, the regular Nuxt error
pages are shown instead, such that the pages can be customized with Nuxt. Defaults to
: If enabled, the menu endpoint will use a language prefix as configured by
: If enabled, the module will create a Nitro server handler that proxies API requests to Drupal backend. Defaults to
: Response headers to pass through from Drupal to the client. Defaults to
. Note: This is only available in SSR mode.
: The log level to use for server-side logging. Defaults to 'info'. Options:
false: The server plugin will not be loaded, keeps the default Nuxt error logging.
'info': Log all server requests and errors.
Runtime config values can be overridden with environment variables via
The following options are deprecated and only there for improved backwards compatibility.
: The base URL of the Drupal /ce-api endpoint, e.g.
is set with the origin of the provided URL.
The module provides a default error handler for the
: Throws an error with the status code and message provided by Drupal.
: Logs an error message to the console and displays a message in the frontend.
You have the option to override the default error handlers by using a parameter when calling the

<script lang="ts" setup>
  const { fetchPage } = useDrupalCe()

  function customPageError (error: Record<string, any>) {
    throw createError({ statusCode: error.value.statusCode, statusMessage: 'No access.', data: {}, fatal: true })
  }
  const page = await fetchPage(useRoute().path, { query: useRoute().query }, customPageError)
</script>

<script lang="ts" setup>
  const { fetchMenu } = useDrupalCe()
  const { getMessages } = useDrupalCe()
  const messages = getMessages()

  function customMenuError (error: Record<string, any>) {
    messages.value.push({
      type: 'error',
      message: `Menu error: Unavailable. ${error.value.statusCode}`
    })
  }
  const mainMenu = await fetchMenu('main', {}, customMenuError)
</script>
parameter is optional and can be omitted.
